none: Northwestern vs. Purdue and Northwestern vs. Illinois
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music

Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1991 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Purdue Boilermakers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Stephen Peterson, performs "Hail Purdue," "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime performance has a outer space theme and includes "Theme from 2001: A Space Odyssey (Sprach Zarathustra)," "The Planets," and a medley from "Star Wars" and "The Empire Strikes Back." John P. Paynter conducts the band in "Alma Mater." Before the second game are scenes from a band practice in Dyche Stadium for a tribute to John P. Paynter on 40 years of service to the Music Department. The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Fighting Illini at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band performs the Illinois Fight Song, "God Bless America," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances begin with "Ya Gotta Try" and "La Suerte de los Tontos." NUMB alums from 1932-1991 join the marching band in a special surprise salute to John P. Paynter for 40 years of service as a faculty member in the Music Department. The combined band performs "Bill Bailey" and "People." John P. Paynter then conducts Alma Mater.

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
